[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Triangulation Games defines requirements for a dynamic combinatorial gameplay system.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Triangulation Games covers implementation with AI and human interaction.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Triangulation Games integrates with Java-based graphical environments and I/O devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Triangulation Games provides a GUI with mouse and keyboard support.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Triangulation Games runs on systems with JRE and graphical output.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Triangulation Games uses Java Swing for GUI and external game definitions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Triangulation Games operates as a standalone application without network needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: Triangulation Games efficiently manages game data and AI processing on Java-supported systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Triangulation Games supports updates, player management, and AI integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Triangulation Games allows configuration for various game setups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: Triangulation Games supports AI and custom game integrations via files.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Triangulation Games enables gameplay, AI, and player management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Triangulation Games is designed for researchers, educators, and gamers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Triangulation Games requires Java 1.8+ runtime and compatible hardware.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Triangulation Game: A strategic game based on triangulation principles.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall load game definitions from XML or text files.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide a GUI with options for starting games and managing players.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to dynamically load AI players during gameplay (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall terminate games based on predefined conditions (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall allow players to switch between human and AI mid-game (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide intuitive controls for selecting games, players, and settings.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall initialize games within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall compute AI decisions within 10 seconds per turn.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store game states to enable resuming games.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall persist player configurations between sessions.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to Java standards for cross-platform compatibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with GPL licensing.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall acknowledge user actions within 1 second (REQ-USAB-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate initialization, AI decisions, and GUI responsiveness.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, configuration guides, and example game definitions.
[SEC] 5. References: Triangulation Games Article, Java Swing Documentation, and GPL License.
